# Hej! 👋🏽 
I am Taimur Khan, a Data Scientist at the [Helmholtz-Center for Environmental Research (UFZ)](https://www.ufz.de/index.php?en=49404) in the [BioDT](https://biodt.eu) project. Combining advances in computational and ecological sciences, I aid partnered researchers and engineers in creating Digital Twin systems that can replicate, monitor, and predict the Earth's dynamic systems using modern methods in software engineering, earth observation, and computational modelling. I am also a part-time Master's student at the [University of Leipzig](https://www.uni-leipzig.de/studium/vor-dem-studium/studienangebot/studiengang/course/show/earth-system-data-science-and-remote-sensing-m-sc), studying Earth System Data Science and Remote Sensing.

## About Me

🌎 **Academic Background:** Geosciences and Physics (Undergraduate) @ [Skidmore College](https://www.skidmore.edu), Earth System Data Science and Remote Sensing (Graduate, ongoing) @ [University of Leipzig](https://www.uni-leipzig.de).

🔬 **Research Enthusiast:** Unraveling Earth's secrets through numerical and statistical models.

💻 **Backend Devotee:** Crafting robust and efficient systems.

🌐 **Web Wizard:** Translating complex computations into user-friendly interfaces.

📊 **Data Whisperer:** Transforming raw data into meaningful stories.

👨🏻‍🏫 **Knowledge Sharer:** Giving workshops and courses on cool methods.

## What's Cookin'

📚 Currently delving into the depths of real-time simulations of Earth's dynamic processes via Digital Twins.

🔧 Building sophisticated backend systems that power cutting-edge scientific applications ranging from ML/AI pipelines to dynamic Digital Twin wokflows.

🧮 Modeling complex systems using High Performance Computing.

🌐 Creating interactive web experiences that bring computational sense to the masses.

📈 Taming complex datasets to reveal patterns, trends, and insights that inspire change.
